chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall E1 E2 E3 : Ens, EQC E1 E2 -> EQC E2 E3 -> EQC E1 E3

Premises:
EQC = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens -> Type) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (eq1 : A -> Ens -> Type) (X0 : Ens) => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Type) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens) (_ : B -> Type) => prod_t (forall x : A, depprod B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) (forall y : B, depprod A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) X : Ens -> Ens -> Type
Inductive Ens : Type := sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens Arguments sup _%type_scope _%function_scope
EQ_tran : forall E1 E2 E3 : Ens, EQ E1 E2 -> EQ E2 E3 -> EQ E1 E3
EQ_sym : forall E1 E2 : Ens, EQ E1 E2 -> EQ E2 E1
EQ_Sing_EQ : forall E1 E2 : Ens, EQ (Sing E1) (Sing E2) -> EQ E1 E2
Couple_IN_Prod : forall E1 E2 E1' E2' : Ens, IN E1' E1 -> IN E2' E2 -> IN (Couple E1' E2') (Prod E1 E2)
Couple_Prod_IN : forall E1 E2 E1' E2' : Ens, IN (Couple E1' E2') (Prod E1 E2) -> IN E1' E1 /\ IN E2' E2
INC = fun E1 E2 : Ens => forall E : Ens, IN E E1 -> IN E E2 : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
CINC = fun E1 E2 : Ens => forall E : Ens, CIN E E1 -> CIN E E2 : Ens -> Ens -> Type
IN = fun E1 E2 : Ens => match E2 with | sup A f => EXType A (fun y : A => EQ E1 (f y)) end : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
EQC_refl : forall E : Ens, EQC E E
Union_IN : forall E E' : Ens, IN E' (Union E) -> EXType Ens (fun E1 : Ens => IN E1 E /\ IN E' E1)
CIN = fun X X0 : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Type) (fun (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens) (_ : A -> Type) => depprod A (fun y : A => EQC X (e y))) X0 : Ens -> Ens -> Type
Ord_sind : forall P : Ens -> SProp, P Vide -> (forall E : Ens, Ord E -> P E -> P (Succ E)) -> (forall E : Ens, (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> Ord e) -> (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> P e) -> P (Union E)) -> (forall E E' : Ens, Ord E -> P E -> EQ E E' -> P E') -> forall e : Ens, Ord e -> P e
Ord_ind : forall P : Ens -> Prop, P Vide -> (forall E : Ens, Ord E -> P E -> P (Succ E)) -> (forall E : Ens, (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> Ord e) -> (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> P e) -> P (Union E)) -> (forall E E' : Ens, Ord E -> P E -> EQ E E' -> P E') -> forall e : Ens, Ord e -> P e
Inductive Ord : Ens -> Prop := Oo : Ord Vide | So : forall E : Ens, Ord E -> Ord (Succ E) | Lo : forall E : Ens, (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> Ord e) -> Ord (Union E) | Eo : forall E E' : Ens, Ord E -> EQ E E' -> Ord E' Arguments Lo _ _%function_scope
collection = forall P : Ens -> Ens -> Prop, (forall x x' y : Ens, EQ x x' -> P x y -> P x' y) -> (forall E : Ens, EXType Ens (P E)) -> forall E : Ens, EXType Ens (fun A : Ens => forall x : Ens, IN x E -> EXType Ens (fun y : Ens => IN y A /\ P x y)) : Prop
IN_Inter_all : forall E E' : Ens, IN E' (Inter E) -> forall E'' : Ens, IN E'' E -> IN E' E''
replacement = forall P : Ens -> Ens -> Prop, functional P -> (forall x y y' : Ens, EQ y y' -> P x y -> P x y') -> (forall x x' y : Ens, EQ x x' -> P x y -> P x' y) -> forall X : Ens, EXType Ens (fun Y : Ens => forall y : Ens, (IN y Y -> EXType Ens (fun x : Ens => IN x X /\ P x y)) /\ (EXType Ens (fun x : Ens => IN x X /\ P x y) -> IN y Y)) : Prop
tout_vide_est_Vide : forall E : Ens, (forall E' : Ens, IN E' E -> F) -> EQ E Vide
Ens_ind : forall P : Ens -> Prop, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_sind : forall P : Ens -> SProp, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_rec : forall P : Ens -> Set, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_rect : forall P : Ens -> Type, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Lo : forall E : Ens, (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> Ord e) -> Ord (Union E)
all_IN_Inter : forall E E' E'' : Ens, IN E'' E -> (forall E''0 : Ens, IN E''0 E -> IN E' E''0) -> IN E' (Inter E)
Eo : forall E E' : Ens, Ord E -> EQ E E' -> Ord E'
IN_Comp_P : forall (E A : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), (forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2) -> IN A (Comp E P) -> P A
IN_P_Comp : forall (E A : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), (forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2) -> IN A E -> P A -> IN A (Comp E P)
functional = fun P : Ens -> Ens -> Prop => forall x y y' : Ens, P x y -> P x y' -> EQ y y' : (Ens -> Ens -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments functional _%function_scope
INC_EQ : forall E E' : Ens, INC E E' -> INC E' E -> EQ E E'
pi2 : forall E : Ens, pi1 E -> Ens
INC_tran : forall E E' E'' : Ens, INC E E' -> INC E' E'' -> INC E E''
INC_sound_right : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E' E'' -> INC E E' -> INC E E''
INC_sound_left : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E E' -> INC E E'' -> INC E' E''
IN_sound_right : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E' E'' -> IN E E' -> IN E E''
IN_sound_left : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E E' -> IN E E'' -> IN E' E''
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
Vide_est_vide : forall E : Ens, IN E Vide -> F
E_not_IN_E : forall E : Ens, IN E E -> F
IN_Union : forall E E' E'' : Ens, IN E' E -> IN E'' E' -> IN E'' (Union E)
Field_theory.PCond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop

```intros E1 E2 E3 H1 H2.
unfold EQC in *.
inversion H1. inversion H2. subst.
unfold EQC.
split; intros.
- split; intros.
  + rewrite H1. assumption.
  + apply H6 with y0. rewrite <- H1. assumption.
- split; intros.
  + rewrite <- H3. assumption.
  + apply H8 with x0. rewrite H3. assumption.```

original: intros E1 E2 E3 H1 H2. unfold EQC in *. inversion H1. inversion H2. subst. unfold EQC. split; intros. - split; intros. + rewrite H1. auto. + apply H6 with y0. rewrite <- H1. auto. - split; intros. + rewrite <- H3. auto. + apply H8 with x0. rewrite H3. auto.
